jcr:content.jcr:title: List of heads of state of Togo

contentheadline.headline: List of heads of state of Togo

contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Political post |post = President |body = the<br/>Togolese Republic |insignia = Coat of arms of Togo.svg |insigniasize = 125px |insigniacaption = [[Coat of arms of Togo]] |nativename = |image = Faure Gnassingbé 29112006.jpg |imagesize = 165px |incumbent = [[Faure Gnassingbé]] |incumbentsince = 4 May 2005 |style = |residence = [[The Palace of the Governors (Togo)|Palace of the Governors]], [[Lomé]] |appointer = |termlength = 5 years |formation = 27 April 1960 |succession = |inaugural = [[Sylvanus Olympio]] |deputy = |salary = |website = }} {{Politics of Togo}} ==Presidents of Togo (1960–Present)== (Dates in italics indicate ''de facto ''continuation of office) {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%;" |- align=left ! width="18%"|Tenure ! width=60|Portrait ! width="55%"|Incumbent ! width="10%"|[[#Affiliations|Affiliation]] ! width="15%"|Notes |- valign=top |colspan="5"|'''[[Togo|Togolese Republic]]''' |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>27 April 1960 to 13 January 1963||[[File:Sylvanus Olympio.jpg|60px]]||'''[[Sylvanus Olympio]]''', <small>President||<small>CUT||<small>[[Sylvanus Olympio#Assassination|Assassinated]] in a ''coup d'état'' |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>13 January 1963 to 15 January 1963|| ||'''[[Emmanuel Bodjollé]]''', <small>Chairman of the Insurrection Committee||<small>Mil|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>16 January 1963 to 13 January 1967|| ||'''[[Nicolas Grunitzky]]''', <small>President||<small>PTP||<small>Deposed in a ''coup d'état'' |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>14 January 1967 to 14 April 1967|| ||'''[[Kléber Dadjo]]''', <small>Chairman of the National Reconciliation Committee||<small>Mil|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>14 April 1967 to ''30 November 1969''||rowspan="3"|[[File:Gnassingbe Eyadema detail1 DF-SC-84-10025.jpg|60px]]||rowspan="2"|'''[[Gnassingbé Eyadéma|Étienne Eyadéma]]''', <small>President||<small>Mil|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>''30 November 1969'' to ''8 May 1974''||rowspan="2"|<small>RPT||<small>Changed name to Gnassingbé Eyadéma |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>''8 May 1974'' to 5 February 2005||'''[[Gnassingbé Eyadéma]]''', <small>President||<small>Died in office |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>5 February 2005 to 25 February 2005||[[File:Faure Gnassingbé 29112006.jpg|60px]]||'''[[Faure Gnassingbé]]''', <small>President||<small>RPT||<small>1st Term; <br>Son of [[Gnassingbé Eyadéma]]. Resigned due to doubts regarding the constitutional legitimacy of his succession. |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>25 February 2005 to 4 May 2005|| ||'''[[Bonfoh Abass]]''', <small>Acting President||<small>RPT||<small>Succeeded Eyadéma as the constitutional successor, [[List of Presidents of the National Assembly of Togo|President of the National Assembly]] |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>4 May 2005 to Present||[[File:Faure Gnassingbé 29112006.jpg|60px]]||'''[[Faure Gnassingbé]]''', <small>President||<small>RPT||<small>2nd Term |} ===Affiliations=== *CAR ([[Action Committee for Renewal]]) *CFN ([[Coordination of New Forces]]) *CPP ([[Patriotic Pan-African Convergence]]) *CUT ([[Committee of Togolese Unity]]) *PTP ([[Togolese Progress Party]]) *RPT ([[Rally of the Togolese People]]) *UTD ([[Togolese Union for Democracy]]) *MIL ([[Military of Togo|Military]]) *n-p (Non-partisan) ==Latest election== {{Togolese presidential election, 2010}} ==See also== *[[Togo]] **[[Politics of Togo]] **[[List of colonial heads of German Togoland]] **[[List of colonial heads of French Togoland]] **[[List of heads of government of Togo]] *[[Lists of Incumbents]] ==External links== *[http://www.worldstatesmen.org/Togo.html World Statesmen - Togo] {{Togo topics}} {{TogolesePresidents}} {{Heads of state and government of African states}} [[Category:Lists of presidents|Togo, List of Presidents of]] [[Category:Presidents of Togo| ]] [[Category:Togo-related lists|Presidents]]
